009package imagingbook.common.morphology;
010
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.List;
013
014import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;

017/**
018 * <p>
019 * Implements a binary morphological thinning or "skeletonization" operation,
020 * based on the algorithm by Zhang and Suen [1].
021 * See Sec. 7.4 (Alg. 7.2-7.3) of [2] for additional details.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * [1] T. Y. Zhang and C. Y. Suen. A fast parallel algorithm for thinning
025 * digital patterns. Communications of the ACM 27(3), 236â€“239 (1984).
026 * <br>
027 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
028 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/09/18
033 */
034public class BinaryThinning implements BinaryMorphologyOperator {
035        
036        private static final byte B0 = (byte) 0;
037        private static final byte B1 = (byte) 1;
038        private static final boolean T = true;
039        private static final boolean F = false;

298        };
299        
300        private final int maxIterations; // set to <=0 to calculate dynamically
301        
302        private boolean complete;               // flag indicating if thinning actually completed
303        private int iterations;                 // number of iterations performed during last applyTo() or reset()
304        
305        /**
306         * Constructor, creates a {@link BinaryThinning} operator
307         * with the maximum number of iterations to be calculated dynamically 
308         * from the size of the processed image.
309         */
310        public BinaryThinning() {
311                this(0);
312        }
313        
314        /**
315         * Constructor, creates a {@link BinaryThinning} operator
316         * with the specified maximum number of iterations.
317         * 
318         * @param maxIterations the maximum number of iterations
319         */
320        public BinaryThinning(int maxIterations) {
321                this.maxIterations = maxIterations;
322        }
323        
324        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
325        
326        /**
327         * Returns the number of iterations performed since the last invocation of
328         * {@link #applyTo(ByteProcessor)} or {@link #reset()}.
329         * @return the number of iterations
330         */
331        public int getIterations() {
332                if (iterations < 0) {
333                        throw new IllegalStateException("no iteration count available, call applyTo() first");
334                }
335                return iterations;
336        }
337        
338        /**
339         * Returns {@code true} if thinning has successfully completed,
340         * {@code false} otherwise.
341         * 
342         * @return {@code true} if successfully completed
343         */
344        public boolean isComplete() {
345                return this.complete;
346        }
347        
348        /**
349         * Resets the internal iteration counter and completion flag.
350         * Provided for debugging or animation only.
351         */
352        public void reset() {
353                iterations = 0;
354                complete = false;
355        }
356        
357        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
358        
359        @Override
360        public void applyTo(ByteProcessor bp) {
361                int iMax = (maxIterations > 0) ? maxIterations : bp.getWidth() + bp.getHeight();
362                reset();
363                do {
364                        thinOnce(bp);
365                } while (!complete && iterations < iMax);
366        }
367        
368        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
369        
370        // Single thinning iteration. Returns the number of deletions performed (for debugging only).
371        /**
372         * Performs a single thinning iteration and returns the number of pixel deletions.
373         * Updates the internal iteration counter and completion flag.
374         * This method is iteratively called by {@link #applyTo(ByteProcessor)}.
375         * It is public only for debugging and animation.
376         * 
377         * @param bp the image to be thinned
378         * @return the number of pixel deletions
379         */
380        public int thinOnce(ByteProcessor bp) {
381                final int M = bp.getWidth();
382                final int N = bp.getHeight();
383                final List<PntInt> D = new ArrayList<>();
384//              final byte[] NH = new byte[8];
385                int n = 0;
386                for (int pass = 0; pass < 2; pass++) {  // make 2 passes
387                        D.clear();
388                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
389                                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
390                                        if (bp.get(u, v) > 0) {
391//                                              get8Neighborhood(ip, u, v, NH);
392//                                              int c = get8NeighborhoodIndex(NH);
393                                                int c = get8NeighborhoodIndex(bp, u, v);
394                                                if (Q[c][pass]) {
395                                                        D.add(PntInt.from(u, v));
396                                                        n = n + 1;
397                                                }
398                                        }
399                                }
400                        }                       
401                        for (PntInt p : D) {
402                                bp.putPixel(p.x, p.y, 0);
403                        }
404                }
405                this.complete = (n == 0);
406                this.iterations++;
407                return n;
408        }
409        
410        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
411        private void get8Neighborhood(ByteProcessor I, int u, int v, byte[] NH) {
412                NH[0] =  binarize(I.getPixel(u+1, v));
413                NH[1] =  binarize(I.getPixel(u+1, v-1));
414                NH[2] =  binarize(I.getPixel(u, v-1));
415                NH[3] =  binarize(I.getPixel(u-1, v-1));
416                NH[4] =  binarize(I.getPixel(u-1, v));
417                NH[5] =  binarize(I.getPixel(u-1, v+1));
418                NH[6] =  binarize(I.getPixel(u, v+1));
419                NH[7] =  binarize(I.getPixel(u+1, v+1));
420        }
421        
422        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
423        private int get8NeighborhoodIndex(byte[] NH) {
424//              int c = 0;
425//              for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
426//                      if (NH[i] != 0) {
427//                              c = c | (1 << i);
428//                      }
429//              }
430//              return c;       // c = 0,...,255
431                return NH[0] + NH[1] * 2 + NH[2] * 4 + NH[3] * 8 + NH[4] * 16 
432                                + NH[5] * 32 + NH[6] * 64 + NH[7] * 128;
433        }
434        
435        // get neighborhood index directly, without extracting neighborhood vector itself:
436        private int get8NeighborhoodIndex(ByteProcessor I, int u, int v) {
437                int c = 0;
438                if (I.getPixel(u+1, v)   != 0)  c+= 1;          // NH[0]
439                if (I.getPixel(u+1, v-1) != 0)  c+= 2;          // NH[1]
440                if (I.getPixel(u, v-1)   != 0)  c+= 4;          // NH[2]
441                if (I.getPixel(u-1, v-1) != 0)  c+= 8;          // NH[3]
442                if (I.getPixel(u-1, v)   != 0)  c+= 16;         // NH[4]
443                if (I.getPixel(u-1, v+1) != 0)  c+= 32;         // NH[5]
444                if (I.getPixel(u, v+1)   != 0)  c+= 64;         // NH[6]
445                if (I.getPixel(u+1, v+1) != 0)  c+= 128;        // NH[7]
446                return c;       // c = 0,...,255
447        }
448
449        // --------------------------------------------------------------
450        
451        // only used once to calculate Q
452        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
453        private static boolean[][] makeDeletionCodeTable() {
454                boolean[][] Q = new boolean[256][2];
455                for (int i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
456                        byte[] N = new byte[8];
457                        for (int j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
458                                N[j] = ((i & (1 << j)) != 0) ? B1 : B0;         // test bit j of i
459                        }
460//                      System.out.format("%d: %s\n", i, Arrays.toString(N));
461                        Q[i][0] = R1(N);
462                        Q[i][1] = R2(N);
463                }               
464                return Q;
465        }
466        
467        // --------------------------------------------------------------
468
469        private static byte binarize(int i) {
470                return (i == 0) ? B0 : B1;
471        }
472
473        private static boolean R1(byte[] NH) {
474                final int b = B(NH);
475                final int c = C(NH);
476                return 
477                        //NH[0] == 1 &&
478                        2 <= b && b <= 6 &&
479                        c == 1 &&
480                        NH[6] * NH[0] * NH[2] == 0 &&
481                        NH[4] * NH[6] * NH[0] == 0;
482        }
483        
484        private static boolean R2(byte[] NH) {
485                final int b = B(NH);
486                final int c = C(NH);
487                return 
488                        //NH[0] == 1 &&
489                        2 <= b && b <= 6 &&
490                        c == 1 &&
491                        NH[0] * NH[2] * NH[4] == 0 &&
492                                NH[2] * NH[4] * NH[6] == 0;
493        }
494        
495        private static int B(byte[] NH) {
496                return NH[0] + NH[1] + NH[2] + NH[3] + NH[4] + NH[5] + NH[6] + NH[7];
497        }
498        
499        private static int C(byte[] NH) { // NH = (N0, N1, N2, N3, N4, N5, N6, N7)
500                int c = 0;
501                for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
502                        c = c + NH[i] * (NH[i] - NH[(i+1) % 8]);
503                }
504                return c;
505        }
506
507        
508        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------

512//               for (int i= 0; i < Q.length; i++) {
513//                       System.out.println(Arrays.toString(Q[i]) + " // " + i);
514//               }
515//      }
516}
